content: --शत्रुः {1} an enemy or destroyer of Indra (when the accent is on the last syllable), an epithet of प्रह्लाद; <ls>R. 7. 35.</ls> {2} [इंद्रः शत्रुः यस्य] one whose enemy is Indra, an epithet of वृत्र (when the accent is on the first syllable). This refers to a legend in the <ls>Śat. Br.</ls>, where it is said that Vṛtra's father intended his son to become the destroyer of Indra, and asked him to say इंद्रशत्रुर्वधस्व &c., but who, through mistake, accented the word on the first syllable, and was killed by Indra; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Śik. 52</ls>: --मंत्रो हीनः स्वरतो वर्णतो वा मिथ्याप्रयुक्तो न तमर्थमाह . स वाग्वज्रो यजमानं हिनास्ति यथेंद्रशत्रुः स्वरतोपराधात् ...
